Documentation: Is the unique identification of a client.
Each outbound delivery has an unique identifier, the outbound delivery number. Outbound deliveries of different clients and system partners can however have the same delivery number.
The associated line of the initial system partner telegram. If a delivery line is added within WAMAS, then this number is set to 0.

Indicates whether this line will be fulfilled via cross docking 1. This means thatseparate PPLUs will be created for the cross docking lines and these PPLUs willbe directly fulfilled by incoming goods loading units without any picking involved.
Is a part of the unique identification of an item.
The variant is the most precise description of an item. With the help of the variant, e.g. colours or sizes of clothing can be specified. Is a part of the unique identification of an item.

Defines the number of base quantity units for the warehouse quantity as a factor. This value is calculated automatically and cannot be changed by the user.This factor is stored redundantly to gain performance during the process and in dialogs.To avoid rounding errors, the number of dual quantity units is stored as a fraction.
Unique identification of a system partner stock group (see SysPartnerStockGroup).
Other End (stockRating): Defines the stock rating of the stock object.

Batch of the item.
Specifies the value (or amount) in the duration unit entered by the user.
Uniquely identifies the time unit.

The production date defines the date on which the product was manufactured.

This field can be used to order a specified loading unit instead of just one item with certain restrictions. Note: The ordered item must be marked with a "virtual" item type.

The item quantity specification in its administration unit (base quantity unit). All state calculations, delivery fulfilled checks and so on are based on the base quantity. The dual quantity has no effect for those calculations.
A picking group represents stock which is picked together onto the same picking LU.
